newsitem.title: VATICAN: Pope urges peace in Congo, Sierra Leone.
newsitem.headline: Pope urges peace in Congo, Sierra Leone.

text.p: Pope John Paul condemned violence in the Congo Republic and Sierra Leone on Sunday and called for reconciliation and a return to constitutional order.
"Violence does not cease to plunge some peoples of Africa into the greatest of sufferings," the Pope told pilgrims in St Peter's Square during his Sunday Angelus address.
He referred specifically to fighting in the Congo Republic and Sierra Leone and called for prayers for the victims of all conflicts in Africa.
Sierra Leone's civilian president Ahmad Tejan Kabbah was toppled in a military coup on May 25.
In the Congo Republic, the capital Brazzaville has been battered by fighting between forces loyal to President Pascal Lissouba and his predecessor Denis Sassou Nguesso.
"Only love and respect for persons and the law can ensure a future of national concord and prosperity for all," the Pope said.
